text: Kinloch is a city in St. Louis County, Missouri, United States. The population was 263 as of the 2020 census. Kinloch is the oldest African-American community to be incorporated in Missouri. Between 1990 and 2000, the city lost more than 80 percent of its population, because the airport expanded into the area, and violence drove people away. ==Notable people== * Maxine Waters, California congresswoman * Jenifer Lewis, film and television actress * Ann Peebles, soul recording artist * Huey, rapper * Barrett Brooks, professional football player * Roy Clay, Silicon Valley pioneer ==References== Category:Cities in Missouri
title: Kinloch, Missouri
